name: Failure Modes & Lessons Learned Agent
tagline: Surfaces relevant failure history to prevent repeat issues
overview: The Failure Modes & Lessons Learned Agent helps engineers access institutional knowledge about past failures, root causes, and corrective actions. It surfaces relevant historical issues during design reviews and helps ensure lessons learned are applied to new designs.
whatItDoes: Searches failure history databases using natural language
Identifies relevant past failures based on design similarity
Surfaces lessons learned during design review preparation
Links failure modes to design recommendations
Tracks closure of lessons-learned actions on new programs
prompts: What failures have we seen with similar turbo bearing designs?
Surface lessons learned relevant to this aftertreatment design
What root causes have been identified for fuel injector failures?
Which design changes addressed the 2022 X15 oil leak issue?
Show me failure modes to review for high-pressure fuel systems
outputs: Relevant failure summaries with root causes
FMEA inputs based on historical data
Lessons learned checklists for design reviews

impact.description: More thorough coverage of historical failure modes
From days of searching archives to instant retrieval

guardrails: Assistive onlyâ€”engineers evaluate applicability to current design
Surfaces information, does not make design decisions
Confidence levels indicate strength of historical matches
Does not replace formal FMEA processes
Sensitive failure data access controlled by role
whatsNext: Building proof of concept with aftertreatment engineering team. Defining data integration requirements.
